intro: Stimpsonia chamaedryoides, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
